block.comment:
This block (digital read setup) tells the Arduino which pin is sense electricity.
A pin is a piece of metal connected to the Arduino used to control or sense electricity.
Below ---- is where you can set values that the virtual circuit will take in.

The void loop function runs over and over again forever
It checks a condition using the if statement, executes a block of code if the condition is true, and otherwise executes the code inside the block when the condition is false.

Compares what is in the left and right holes and returns true or false.
If the operator is "and", it will check if both values are equal to true. If the operator is "or", it will check if one of the values are true.
Returns true if the sensor is sensing something.
Returns true if the sensor is sensing something.
Set defined pin to HIGH or LOW to turn on or off the LED light.
